Hamas builds tunnels for transporting weapons but never bothered to build underground bunkers for its civilian population. Why? Because the more dead children, the better for their propaganda machine.

 The good news is that the majority of Israeli's understand the propaganda game being waged against them, and they support hitting the terrorists where their weapons are fired from. Their attitude is, if the Palestinians don't care about their citizens enough to protect them from the line of fire, and consciously place them in harms way for their propaganda value, then why is it Israel's responsibility to worry about them during a shooting war? The answer is, it isn't. Here is a paper written by another famous American liberal regarding the game Hamas is playing with the lives of their innocent citizens. Here's an excerpt from that paper:
 The Hamas war crime strategy
 
 By Mr. Dershowitz, law professor at Harvard. Hudson, January 8, 2009.
 
 As Israel persists in its military efforts - by ground, air and sea - to protect its citizens from deadly Hamas rockets, and as protests against Israel increase around the world, the success of the abominable Hamas double war crime strategy becomes evident. 
 The strategy is as simple as it is cynical: provoke Israel by playing Russian roulette with its children, firing rockets at kindergartens, playgrounds and hospitals; hide behind its own civilians when firing at Israeli civilians; refuse to build bunkers for its own civilians; have the TV cameras ready to transmit every image of dead Palestinians, especially children; exaggerate the number of civilians killed by including as "children" Hamas fighters who are 16 or 17 years old and as "women," female terrorists.
 
 Hamas itself has a name for this. They call it "the CNN strategy" (this is not to criticize CNN or any other objective news source for doing its job; it is to criticize Hamas for exploiting the freedom of press which it forbids in Gaza). The CNN strategy is working because decent people all over the world are naturally sickened by images of dead and injured children. When they see such images repeatedly flashed across TV screens, they tend to react emotionally.
 
 Rather than asking why these children are dying and who is to blame for putting them in harms way, the average viewer, regardless of their political or ideological perspective, wants to see the killing stopped. They blame those whose weapons directly caused the deaths, rather than those who provoked the violence by deliberately targeting civilians. They forget the usual rules of morality and law. 
 For example, when a murderer takes a hostage and fires from behind his human shield, and a policeman, in an effort to stop the shooting accidentally kills the hostage, the law of every country holds the hostage taker guilty of murder even though the policeman fired the fatal shot. The same is true of the law of war. The use of human shields, in the way Hamas uses the civilian population of Gaza, is a war crime - as is its firing of rockets at Israeli civilians. Every human shield that is killed by Israeli self defense measures is the responsibility of Hamas, but you wouldn't know that from watching the media coverage.
 
 The CNN strategy seems to work better, at least in some parts of the world, against Israel that it would against other nations. There are many more protests - and fury - directed against Israel when it inadvertently kills fewer than 100 civilians in a just war of self defense, than against Arab and Muslim nations and groups that deliberately kill far more civilians for no legitimate reason. The Hamas war crime strategy - Likud of Holland / Likoed Nederland
 
 If you had any sense of justice or balance at all, you would recognize and acknowledge the responsibility which falls squarely on the shoulders of this terrorist group for the human carnage it is causing. But like a blind man you lash out at the IDF for simply defending itself against the rockets fired from those locations where civilians have been placed as sacrificial lambs to allah, the demon god they worship. Which of course explains why you side with the terrorists. How proud you must be to defend those who refuse peace as you condemn those who took thousands of unanswered rockets before responding to end these unending rocket attacks from these terrorists.

In the past year and a half more than 1,600 instances of stress were reported. Approximately 70% of Sderot residents suffer from signs of post traumatic stress disorder which include extreme stress and anxiety. According to a recent Natal report, between 70% to 94% of Sderot children show symptoms of PTSD. The Natal study found 28 percent of adults and 30 percent of children in Sderot actually have post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
 
 Approximately 3000 patient files have been opened in the Sderot Mental Health Center due to the rocket fire environment. In the year 2007 alone, 1,117 trauma victim files were opened, up significantly from 2006. Anxiety symptoms among children often include sleeping difficulties, nightmares, sweating, development regressions, wetting beds, and fear of the outside.  Also if Israel want true peace with the Palestinian people they will need to negotiate with organisations like Hamas, after all they have been democratically elected. 
 
 The Israeli Government should also take the example of the UK and how it dealt with the IRA. During the troubles the British Government opened up secret negations with the IRA, even while the IRA where still bombing the British mainland, shooting British troops and killing Loyalists.
 
 The result of these negations is that the IRA has fully embraced the democratic process and Sinn Féin(the political wing of the IRA) has became part of power sharing Government in Northern Ireland.
smiley

Ah, but God has made Himself evident in His Creation. To deny that is to deny a whole world of evidence which surrounds you each and every day of your life. You are so full of yourself though that you can't get out of your own way long enough to see Him.

 Now it is my turn to be amused. You talk of denying a whole world of evidence, which is your very calling card You've been looking in that mirror again, haven't you Archie?
 
 
Here is what I mean, He say's it better than I can.
 Rom 1:19 because that which is known about God is evident within them; for God made it evident to them.
 Rom 1:20 For since the creation of the world His invisible attributes, His eternal power and divine nature, have been clearly seen, being understood through what has been made, so that they are without excuse.
 Rom 1:21 For even though they knew God, they did not honor Him as God or give thanks, but they became futile in their speculations, and their foolish heart was darkened.
 Rom 1:22 Professing to be wise, they became fools, 

 Here we go again, using the word of a man as 'evidence' of the existence of a god. You are seeing evidence where there is none.
 
 
The date isn't really unspecified. You will know the eternal truth of what you squandered seconds after this body dies and your spirit is freed.

 After I'm dead, I won't be learning anything. You have no evidence otherwise. And saying, "but there must be something more," is not evidence, it's just wishful thinking.
 
 
Dissonant is a bad word to describe what you guys are. It means discordant and inharmonious. You guys are plain old stubborn and rebellious against the very idea of God. But never have I said, implied or inferred that you are inferior to me because of that stubbornness. Although I have said that I am unworthy to have received the grace that has been shown to me. 

 So, you have never said that you have a personal relationship with god that we spiritually dead secular humanist don't. That sound like a superiority complex to me.
 
 
This isn't about being good enough to be saved smiley, because if we were good enough, we wouldn't need to be saved. Get it? God doesn't love the greatest Apostle that ever lived one iota more than He loves YOU. God is not partial, nor is He a respecter of men that any should boast. 

 God doesn't do anything.
 
 
See the verses above. God Himself has supplied the evidence all around you of His existence. If you reject that, then you will surely be without excuse.

 Another example of using the word of man as evidence of god. Unfortunately, you will never see this.
 
 Smiley
